result.reason: Feature request to support connection aliases/links instead of full duplication, reducing sync issues when the same connection appears in multiple folders
result.approach: Add a LinkTarget property to ConnectionInfo that references another connection's ID. When a connection is a link, it delegates all property reads to the target. Serializers save/load link references. Tree operations offer 'Create Link' alongside 'Duplicate'.

attempts.raw_output:
Let me analyze issue #984 to understand what it's requesting.

The issue title "Create link to connection instead of duplicating?" is a feature request asking for the ability to create references/links/aliases to existing connections rather than having to duplicate them. This would allow users to have the same connection appear in multiple folders/locations without maintaining separate copies that could get out of sync.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"Feature request to support connection aliases/links instead of full duplication, reducing sync issues when the same connection appears in multiple folders","priority":"P3-enhancement","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Connection/ConnectionInfo.cs","mRemoteNG/Tree/TreeNodeCopier.cs","mRemoteNG/Config/Serializers/Xml/XmlConnectionNodeSerializer.cs","mRemoteNG/Config/Serializers/Xml/XmlConnectionsDeserializer.cs"],"approach":"Add a LinkTarget property to ConnectionInfo that references another connection's ID. When a connection is a link, it delegates all property reads to the target. Serializers save/load link references. Tree operations offer 'Create Link' alongside 'Duplicate'."}
```
